repnme.cdata!:
Tajikistan - Third Fast Track Initiative
            Catalytic Fund Grant Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Fast Track
            Initiative Catalytic Fund Grant Project for Tajikistan were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: project's
            results framework was feasible, centered on basic output
            indicators that could have been measured realistically, and
            that the project could impact, with some stretch, during its
            short implementation period. For an investment operation,
            the design of a project's results framework should be
            based on readily available and easy to measure data; the
            ability of the implementing agency to monitor; and on
            indicators that measure impacts that can be (directly)
            attributed to the project. While for a project of medium- to
            longer-term implementation it is desirable to measure
            intermediate or final outcomes, a project of shorter
            duration cannot be expected to influence these. Similarly,
            while it may be desirable to have more complex indicators,
            improperly established monitoring systems could result in
            challenges when measuring progress. Therefore, it will be
            preferable to create indicators that are simple, and easy to
            quantify and measure. Similarly, programmatic-type
            operations provide an appropriate instrument for
            implementing, learning, adjusting, and improving. But, for
            these benefits, follow-on operations need to evaluate,
            learn, and revise adjusting activities to account for
            capacities and realities. Significant attention is directed
            toward incorporating 'lessons learned,' but
            projects often summarize lessons of similar or other
            operations without sufficiently adjusting them to
            incorporate past lessons. This project's design and
            implementation are examples of best practices in terms of
            reflecting learning, and adjusting adequately to improve results.

repnme.cdata!: Basic education accessible for all Tajiks

abstracts.cdata!:
Tajikistan aims to deliver better
            education by fixing rundown schools and supplying them with
            furniture and basic equipment. In addition, new textbooks
            and educational materials are being printed. Teachers and
            principals receive additional training and qualifications,
            while school management and financing has been reformed. Per
            capita financing has been introduced nationwide along with
            an education management information system. Education is one
            of the most vital tools for development, prosperity and
            growth. Thus, through investing in education, Tajikistan is
            investing in one of its most valuable assets, its human
            capital. As Tajikistan contributes to the development of its
            young and growing population, it is also investing in its
            future growth and the well-being of its society at large.

repnme.cdata!:
Tajikistan - Third Fast Track Initiative
            Catalytic Fund Grant Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Third Fast Track
            Initiative Catalytic Fund Grant Project for Tajikistan is to
            contribute to an increased access to improved learning
            environments and a more efficient delivery of quality
            education services. This project paper seeks your approval
            for the extension to the closing date for the Fast Track
            (FTI) Initiative Catalytic Fund Grant by nine months, from
            September 30, 2012 to June 30, 2013. This will be the second
            extension for this Grant bringing the total number of
            extended months to 24. The paper also seeks your approval
            for the revision of the grant agreement to include the
            rehabilitation and provision of furniture to the dormitory
            of the Republican Institute for In-service Teacher Training
            (RIITT) in the grant's scope of activities. The
            extension is necessary in order to enable the recipient to
            complete activities that have already started being
            implemented, achieve the Project Development Objective
            (PDO). This will be the second extension for the project,
            amounting to a total of 24 months. Since effectiveness, the
            project has disbursed USD 5.74 million (35.4 percent) and
            has commitments for another USD5.4 million. Additionally,
            there are also several important surveys planned under the
            project that will need more time for completion.  Those
            include: 'operational and financial audit of the
            textbooks revolving system,' 'review of the
            in-service training programs,' and 'school
            transportation.'  The design of the surveys also took
            more time than expected due to their complexity and lack of
            adequate expertise on the client's side. An extension
            will allow for the completion of these surveys.

display_title.display_title:
Tajikistan - Third Fast Track
            Initiative Catalytic Fund Grant Project : restructuring :
            Main report
